title.narrative: UNDP EIA i Ukraina - Förberedande stöd till det nationella registret
UNDP EIA in Ukraine – Preparatory support to the National Registry

description.narrative: The project objective is to develop a well-functioning Unified National Environmental Impact Assessment Registry fully consistent with the appropriate EU standards and tailored to the context in Ukraine. The purpose of the Registry is to enable the transparent process of the conducting the EIA for a new project. It records and makes publicly available online the assessment of a potential project’s effects for the environment and human health, and records decisions and measures aimed at preventing, avoiding, reducing, eliminating significant negative environmental impacts of the planned activity. The Registry aims to contain open documentation for business and the public at all stages of the EIA procedure, which reduces corruption factors in decision making. A key result of the project is the provision of software for launching a fully functional web-based Registry to the Ministry of Ecology, as well as technical assistance and communication support to the first cases entered in to the Registry.

Projektets syfte är att bistå Ukrainas regering (Ministeriet för ekologi och naturresurser) i implementeringen av lagen om miljökonsekvensanalys. I ett första steg kommer projektet, som implementeras av UNDP, att utveckla ett fungerande elektroniskt Unified National Environmental Impact Assessment Register (ett register över alla inkomna ansökningar till myndigheter där någon sorts miljöprövning är nödvändig) i enlighet med relevant EU-standard. Registret kommer att skräddarsys för den ukrainska kontexten. Detta projekt kommer att ligga till grund för den fortsatta implementeringen av lagen som innefattar kapacitetsutveckling av de centrala och lokala myndigheterna, utbildningar för intressenter i enlighet med deras roll i systemet etc.

The project purpose is to assist the Government of Ukraine (Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources) in the process of the Environmental Impact Assessment Law implementation. At the first stage, the project, implemented by the UNDP, will develop a well-functioning electronic Unified National Environmental Impact Assessment Registry in accordance with the appropriate EU standards and tailored to the context in Ukraine. This project will also lay the groundwork for the further implementation of the Law that will include capacity building of the central and local authorities, trainings for stakeholders in accordance with their role in the system etc.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Since December 2017 the project has achieved the following specific results: • UNDP has developed and launched a pilot (in 2017-2018) and a full-fledged (in 2019) versions of the IT System “Unified Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Registry”. Documentation for the full-fledged System has been transferred to the Ministry of Environment (MENR) along with UNDP letter UNDP/2019/314 dated 23 December 2019, specifically: final specification of the System, API specification, visualisation of graphic design of all modules, System development report and recommendations, quality assurance reports, Administrator Manual and User Manual, drafts of transfer documentation and request to appoint authorised representatives to accept the software product. • Four thousand three hundred forty-seven (4,347) cases and over five thousand (5,000) users and administrators have been registered in the EIA Registry System between December 2017 and June 2020. • Technical support to MENR in maintaining the EIA Registry and preparing initial cases of environmental impact assessment in the pilot version of the Registry has been provided in 2018. • Communication and outreach support to the launch of the pilot version of the EIA Registry has been provided. Total at least 29,600 people were reached through awareness-raising and educational activities of the project on the EIA procedure through a variety of channels, including events, direct information distribution, social media, mass media in 2018. Additionally, 37 journalists (31 women, 6 men) were educated on EIA issues within the regional Schools of Environmental Journalism in 2019 (organised in synergy with UNDP/Sweden project “Support to the Parliament of Ukraine in SEE area”). • Cloud solution for hosting the Environmental Impact Assessment Registry has been identified and the System has been moved to the cloud infrastructure, ensuring thesustainability of its operation from 2019. The full-fledged version was launched in December 2019 already in cloud infrastructure. • Forty-eight (48) regional and national administrators were trained on the use of the full-fledged version of the EIA Registry upon the System was launched in 2019. As of 31 December 2019, the project has completed all planned activities and incurred expenses (full asset cost) of $118,027.07 (99% of the total project budget) with a remaining balance of $1,719.06. On the 24th of December 2020 the full-fledged EIA Registry has been oficially handed over to the Ministry of Environment of Ukraine marking the official completion of the project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
